text: what is April Fool's Day well a fool is
someone who is silly or stupid April 1st
is a day to play jokes these jokes
aren't meant to be cruel we trick people
into believing things in order to make
them laugh when they find out the truth
on April 1st everyone and anyone can be
fooled do you understand these
expressions to play a joke on someone or
trick someone is to make someone believe
that something is true or real to be
fooled by something or someone is to be
made to believe that something is true
or real so let's play a game I'll tell
you a statement and you tell me if it's
true or false number one I have a pet
goat I keep it in my backyard false I'm
joking I don't have a goat too I used to
work as a Hawaiian dancer true I'm not
kidding
I really did work as a Polynesian dancer
during my summer vacations from college
three in one of my previous jobs I had
to wear a duck costume true I'm not
fooling I once worked as a youth
counselor on a cruise ship and on
occasion I was asked to dress up as a
duck among other animals in order to
entertain the children Here I am in
costume well part of it for this is my
home
I'm just pulling your leg I live in a
modern house the picture you saw was
taken in Russia at an outdoor museum in
this lesson you heard four expressions
that mean I'm not serious they are I'm
joking I'm just kidding I'm only fooling
I'm just pulling your leg
